alert.note: Alert for Western Essex (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 23 at 4:09PM EST until December 23 at 6:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of northern New York and Vermont, including the following counties, in northern New York, Western Clinton and Western Essex. In Vermont, Addison, Chittenden, Rutland, Windsor, Orange and Washington. * WHEN...Through Saturday at 700 pm. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Rivers most susceptible to minor flooding are the Otter Creek, Mad River, and Winooski River from Waterbury downstream to Essex. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Between 0.50 and 2.5 inches of rainfall have fallen across much of the Flood Watch area over the past 12 hours. This rainfall, combined with 0.5 to 1 inch of snowmelt will lead to sharp rises on area streams and some rivers. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
